page.title: 09Farming at Balnault Farm
page.content: Balnault Farm forms the way of life and income for the Fraser family. At times everyone- husband, wife and 2 young sons help on the farm. The work involves rearing cattle, sheep and pigs, and growing fodder for these animals. In summer most of the work is based on growing and harvesting the winter fodder mainly hay, silage, barley, and swedes. In winter most time is spent feeding livestock. Spring is the busiest time- crops have to be planted, and the sheep are lambing. Everyone works from dawn to dusk (and later) at this time. Many jobs must be done at short notice- repairing machinery, moving animals etc. Some jobs are only done once or twice a year- shearing sheep, dipping sheep, repairing fences, mucking out the cattle courts etc.
